intro: Warneckea atrovirens, commonly known as the black-barked warneckea, is a tropical tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, almost black bark that gives it its common name. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It produces small, white flowers followed by red, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. Warneckea atrovirens is often found in moist forests and is valued for its timber and medicinal properties.
